title: What type of pop is better, J-pop or K-pop? - Quora

response.answer_text: I only really listened to J-pop when I was much younger so I probably don’t have the best judgement on up to date J-pop music but from when I did listen, comparing that to K-pop of that time (around 2009ish) and the K-pop of today, it’s safe to say that they are totally different. The countries may be next to eachother however they exert such difference in their music and the morals behind their music (meaning the way Japanese and Koreans view their idols and what they see an idol’s purpose as) I can’t say which one is better or worse because that’s too subjective but I can do my best to compare them. K-pop is definitely a lot more mainstream in the ears of a Westerner. J-pop don’t take as much of a musical influence from Western music in comparison to K-pop, which gives J-pop a much more distinct sound. What I mean is, even if they both sang in English, a Westerner would be able to guess which one was a Japanese composition. J-pop still focuses their idols on being ‘kawaii’ or cute with a touch of sexiness, not changing this image or taking any inspirations from Western pop whereas K-pop have much more Western-influenced concepts in most concepts, not all though depending on the company and their vision, for example, BTS’s CEO Hitman Bang explains he got a lot of his visions for music videos and concept storylines from animes and books, which is more of a Japanese-Korean concept in comparison to the normal Western-Korean concepts. In conclusion, depending on whether you like that distinct sound of the J-pop genre or a more Western influenced sound from K-pop (with exceptions) will depend on which one you prefer.

As a person who grew up around j-pop but moved to kpop afterwards, I’m gonna say kpop here are the main reasons why, at least for the songs that I’ve heard, Kpop has more English words than Jpop which is an advantage attracting more people, not only Koreans, the choreography is more complicated and ‘different’, a lot of the Jpop songs don’t have a choreography, I think it’s a tie when it comes to vocals, Music videos are more good than Jpop songs mv, Kpop music is a lot trendier, most of the popular Jpop artists I see are usually perform songs from an anime, solo artists in Jpop and kpop are less famous but merely Jpop, IU is pretty famous, Sunmi, Chungha, Rain who’s also one of the most popular male artist/actor in Asia, Dean, Crush etc. Also, J-pop never pushed itself towards the Western industry (other than anime) as much as kpop died, they barely even tried to. Also, both of them have really influenced the modern-day culture (mostly fashion & trends). Also both are very similar when you look at it. And There’s also a different topic that discusses why kpop fans are different from Jpop fans and why the Music videos are better than Jpop music video.

Now, I do have to say the only Japanese songs I listen to are Taemin's Sayonara Hitori, Famous and Flame of Love, iKon's I'm Ok and Super★Dragon’s Warning, Sweet Devil and Monster. Super★Dragon is a pop/rock group so their music is somewhat rougher than most kpop groups, as for Taemin's songs they're good. At the end I have to say k-pop, because I haven't listened to j-pop as much, it's mainly rock.
